review: This is an amazing device especially if you use hulu or netflix alot. It's very easy to use, so I believe anyone with basic knowledge of hdmi ports, smart phones and apps can use it well. There are two bad things(not necessarily the chromecasts fault) though, Google isn't currently spreading the API, so some apps wont get chromecast capability for awhile. Second thing is that I live with family and quite a few devices are using the internet on certain weekends, so I have alot of problems with Hulu and chromecast. Constantly desyncing, pausing and sometimes even stopping all together. It's not really the chromecasts fault, but be warned if you live in a family that does alot of online gaming be warned it may cause problems with you connectivity.Other than that I LOVE this thing, it's my favorite purchase so far.
author: Tyler Kellett

review: I bought this for the attractive price tag despite living in an ios environment. However, after using it for a couple days, I can confidently say I'd pay three times more for an Apple TV. The chromecast lacks a lot of flexibility and ironically, openness. Whereas with an Apple TV I can go to any random video/audio app and in all likelihood it will AirPlay (not to mention near seamless mirroring), one can only chromecast from a handful of apps. The chromecast feels like a middle man rather than a liaison between my ipad and the TV. It honestly feels prohibitive. The lack of a Dedicated GUI and remote is unfortunate, sometimes you just want media controls handy without using your device.I also get audio/volume issues when switching between casting apps and other apps I'm using, though this could just be an ios bug.Ultimately it lacks a lot functionality and flexibility that I had grown accustomed to on the Apple TV. Perhaps I should've researched what I was buying but I don't even see them as competitors or substitutes at this point in time. At the moment I'd certainly recommend an Apple TV or a roku over the chromecast. While I do love the chromecast's compact design, it leaves me wanting. Perhaps in time, the chromecast can make strides, but bottom line it feels inferior.

review: Works as advertised and easy to set up with compatible Android device with the free Chromecast app downloaded.  Nice to be able to view Youtube on the main boobtube, though otherwise pretty much duplicates content offered on Roku, but has only a fraction as much.  If you already have a Roku or similar with wider content offerings, it's not particularly exciting, and we have ended up using it only to watch Youtube videos on the TV so far, but it's worth the modest price.
